<@UFC7CRXMZ>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Recipe Substitutions - Lamb`
*Topic:* `Menu & Recipes`
*Priority:* `Critical! ðŸ”¥`
*Description:* `Anisha shared this issue that was flagged to her - this is urgent to look into.

CC flagged that existing customers are getting substituted chicken instead of the lamb they had in their dashboard. I thought this should have only impacted new customers not being able to select lamb. Can we please look into this asap?

From CC
I wanted to bring up a concern raised by an agent today about the Lamb & Beef recipe under the Air-Dried Plan. A customer reached out letting us know that their Lamb & Beef meal was replaced with a chicken recipe. We also noticed that the Lamb & Beef recipe appears to have been removed from the website's product section.`
*Expected behaviour:* `na`
*Actual behaviour:* `na`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
ok quick clarification, what I came across was a bug relating to change plans where we're not correctly refreshing the dashboard after the user changes their plan, the change was applied correctly but is not visible unless the user refreshes the page. I will create a ticket to resolve that right away.

Aside from that <@U0177S413PC> we don't see any issues with the lamb recipe specifically and it seems to be working as expected, if you have more info you could share let us know

elements.text:
ok quick clarification, what I came across was a bug relating to change plans where we're not correctly refreshing the dashboard after the user changes their plan, the change was applied correctly but is not visible unless the user refreshes the page. I will create a ticket to resolve that right away.

Aside from that
we don't see any issues with the lamb recipe specifically and it seems to be working as expected, if you have more info you could share let us know

_thread_replies.text: Thanks, so far it was just this instance and other use cases as working. Please review and let us know if this is isolated or an issue for other customers

_thread_replies.text: What's odd is that I do not see that they selected a bag of treats for the delivery on 26th of Nov. I can see through our traces that they've been ~might selecting/deselecting addons only from the 23rd of Nov so their delivery on the 26th of November would've been post cutoff (and unaffected by any changes made)~ actually when investigating deeper I see that there have been no requests for addon selections

<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Reschedule Function Change Delivery Day`
*Topic:* `Delivery Date and Cadence`
*Priority:* `Medium priority ðŸŸ¡`
*Description:* `I was working through an issue with a customer who said that he was receiving less food than expected after he rescheduled a box but future week didn't adjust the delivery day so he was getting his next box 5.5 weeks after vs 5 weeks. I had to walk him through how to change his delivery day in his settings but it is not clear on the dashboard and rescheduling function that he his next box would not reschedule to exactly 5 weeks from that box. Is this an expected behavior? If so, we should look into the rescheduling function language and/or make the reschedule trigger a delivery day change. `
*Expected behaviour:* `Delivery day to autmoatically adjust for future delivery weeks when rescheduling a box`
*Actual behaviour:* `Delivery day didn't adjust, only delivery week. Customer still needed to go to account settings to adjust delivery day`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue
attachments.text:

_thread_replies.text:
Hi all,
We had a discussion about it some time ago.
Current state:
â€¢ Changing the delivery window (weekday of the delivery) is only possible from settings
â€¢ If rescheduling results a change of a delivery week, we are pushing out the following delivery by the preset cadence (eg 6 weeks from the newly selected delivery week), but we keep the original delivery window weekday the user had before
We can change this behavior in 2 ways:
â€¢ make default delivery window aligned with the newest weekday the user selected
â€¢ offer a choice after the user reschedules, asking them if they want to change their their default delivery window. 

This will be a separate request though

elements.text:
Hi all,
We had a discussion about it some time ago.
Current state:
Changing the delivery window (weekday of the delivery) is only possible from settings

If rescheduling results a change of a delivery week, we are pushing out the following delivery by the preset cadence (eg 6 weeks from the newly selected delivery week), but we keep the original delivery window weekday the user had before
We can change this behavior in 2 ways:
make default delivery window aligned with the newest weekday the user selected
offer a choice after the user reschedules, asking them if they want to change their their default delivery window.
This will be a separate request though

_thread_replies.text: I'm confused. Can we discuss in our tech call later this morning pls
